titleStmt.title: The golden garland of princely pleasures and delicate delights Wherin is conteined the histories of many of the kings, queenes, princes, lords, ladies, knights, and gentlewomen of this kingdome. Being most pleasant songs and sonnets to sundry new tunes now most in vse: the third time imprinted, enlarged and corrected by Rich. Iohnson. Deuided into two parts.
titleStmt.author: Johnson, Richard, 1573-1659?

publicationStmt.publisher: By A. M[athewes] for Thomas Langley, and are to be sold at his shop ouer against the Sarazens Head without Newgate,

notesStmt.note: Imperfect; leaves B2 and G7-8 are mutilated, affecting text.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop ouer against the Sarazens Head without Newgate
